answerText: rondeaux [10] Name this French poetic form consisting of 15 lines on two rhymes. The last two stanzas end with a refrain which is also used at the beginning of the first line.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Michigan A + George Mason | 15 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Probably the most famous example of this poetic form is John McCrae's "In Flanders Fields." For 10 points each: [10] Name this French poetic form consisting of 15 lines on two rhymes. The last two stanzas end with a refrain which is also used at the beginning of the first line.
